#Summary1=(human1) This guide explains how to grow Beavertail cactus, either from seeds in a shady garden in moist soil, leading to flowers in 4 years, or more quickly from cuttings, 6 months or older, cured in dry shade for 10-14 days, then planted upright in pots with drainage holes in the sun, watering after a month and letting soil dry, as well as fertilizing in spring, summer and fall.

#Summary2=(human2) To grow the Beavertail Cactus, there are two primary methods, which include scattering the seeds in a shaded bed for slower growth or planting your own cuttings from a previously owned cactus in a soil and sand mixture and place in direct sunlight, while ensuring the roots are not oversaturated with water in the first month and that the cactus receives a balanced fertilizer.

#Summary3=(human3) This guide explains two main methods for growing Beavertail Cactus: 1) scattering seeds in a shady bed, and 2) planting cuttings in a mix of soil and sand and ensuring sufficient water and lots of sun for faster results.

#Summary4=(human4) The guide discusses two methods of growing Beavertail Cactus; the slower method is to purchase seeds and grow the cactus in a shady garden bed, and the faster method is to get Beavertail cactus cuttings and grow them in a pot with potting mix under plenty of sun.

#Summary5=(human5) Using detailed instructions of two growth methods, this article describes how Beavertail Cacus can grow either by scattering purchased seeds in a shady garden bed and waiting 4 years, or by planting Beavertail cuttings in a mix of soil and sand and ensuring there is plenty of sunlight to grow quicker compared to planting seeds
#Text=How to Grow Beavertail Cactus

#Text=The Beavertail Cactus ( Opunitia basilares ) , found primarily in the Mojave Desert and northwest Mexico ; can grow to be about 24 inches ( 60 cm ) high ; has pads that look like beavertails ; and yields red or purple flowers from spring to early summer .

#Text=Growing Beavertail can be done at any time of year by scattering seeds in a shady bed or , for faster results , planting cuttings in a mix of soil and sand and ensuring that they have a bit of water and plenty of sun .
#Text=Read the following steps to find out how to grow Beavertail cactus .
#Text=Method 1 of 2 : From Seeds
#Text=Purchase Beavertail cactus seeds .
#Text=These can be bought at garden centers or purchased online .
#Text=Scatter the seeds .
#Text=In a shady garden bed , simply scatter the seeds on the soil .
#Text=There 's no need to cover them , unless you want to use netting to keep the birds off .
#Text=Keep the soil moist until the seeds germinate .
#Text=Make sure that the garden bed is in the shade .
#Text=Beavertail cacti seeds need shade to grow , whereas cuttings need plenty of direct sunlight .
#Text=Be aware that growing Beavertail cactus from seeds takes much longer than growing one from a cutting .
#Text=It can take as long as 4 to 4 years before you get flowers .
#Text=Method 2 of 2 : From Cuttings
#Text=Obtain Beavertail cuttings .
#Text=You can purchase them online or at a local garden center .
#Text=If you already own a Beavertail cactus , you can make your own cuttings .
#Text=To do this , choose pads ( the flat , oval - shaped sections that make up a cactus ) that are 6 months old or older and cut them at the base .
#Text=In order to form a callous and prevent rot , cure the cuttings by sitting the pad upright in a dry , dark place for 10 to 14 days .
#Text=Plant the cuttings .
#Text=Prepare a potting mix that is equal parts soil and rough pumice or sand and fill the appropriate number of pots with it .
#Text=Make sure there are holes in the center of the base of each pot to allow for good drainage .
#Text=Set the cuttings upright in the potting mix about an inch ( 2.5 cm. ) deep .
#Text=If you plant the cuttings too deep , they might rot .
#Text=Put some rocks around the pad to anchor it in place .
#Text=Choose a spot for your Beavertail cactus cuttings .
#Text=If you live in an area with strong summer sun , position the cuttings so that the broad sides of the cuttings face east and west while the slim sides face north and south .
#Text=This will prevent the cuttings from burning during the hottest part of the day .
#Text=Make sure the spot is sheltered from any cold winter winds .
#Text=Wait for a month .
#Text=Do not water the cutting for the first month .
#Text=The moisture in the pad will provide enough nutrients for roots to grow .
#Text=Too much water might cause rot .
#Text=After 1 month , roots will have sprouted and you can water the cutting for the first time .
#Text=Always let the soil dry before you water the cuttings .
#Text=Once fully rooted , they are extremely drought resistant .
#Text=Fertilize the plants .
#Text=During the spring , summer , and fall , the Beavertail cactus grows and will benefit from a balanced fertilizer .
#Text=Let the cuttings grow .
#Text=From the first pad , many more will form .
#Text=The second or third pad will bear some flowers , but wait before harvesting them or you might affect the size of future harvests .
